sense.name: the physical act of building a structure or edifice
sense.examples: The construction of the new dam is projected to take three years. The children cut out figures from blue and yellow construction paper. (paper for constructing things) Those houses are all new construction. (Singular here is a mass noun, still closely aligned with the 'act of building' sense, in contrast to 'these houses are new constructions' Plural - which is the countable noun sense 3. The sounds from the construction woke us up early every morning.

sense.name: a business or enterprise that builds structures, e.g., houses, skyscrapers
sense.examples: The construction workers whistled at Mary as she walked by. Analysts expect some cooling off this quarter in the construction industry. John's dad runs a construction company in Dallas. He's been working in construction for ten years.

sense.name: a physical building, structure or artifact
sense.examples: The inspector pointed out the shoddy construction at the building site. His home is a modern post-and-beam construction. Those new constructions were all built at the factory and assembled on the lots. We admired the sculptor's bronze abstract constructions.

sense.name: a grammatical constituent, e.g., noun phrase
sense.examples: Let's look at some extended adjective constructions in German. The implied subject of this embedded construction must match the subject of the main clause. The translator must align these French nominal constructions with corresponding English ones.

sense.name: a mental activity of construing or interpreting
sense.examples: The playwright's construction of conflicting goals among the main characters works well. They put an unsympathetic construction on his conduct. I think her construction of the relevant events that contributed to this is somewhat biased. The construction of a new unified field theory has been arduous and elusive.

sense.name: a mathematical figure
sense.examples: A hypercube is a construction with four spatial dimensions. The children had to draw constructions of various geometric figures. A Mobius strip is a strange, one-sided construction.
